gurmukhi: eyk kIey su rQI ibrQI Air eykn ko bhu Gwien GwXo ]sXwm BnY sB sUrn ko ieh BwNiq hlI purKq idKwXo ]1835]
transliteration: Ek Keee Rathibirthiar(i) Ekan Ko Bahu Ghaayo|| Syaam Bhanai Sabh Sooran Ko Eh Bhaant(i) Halipurkhat Dikhaayo||1835||
translation: He deprived many chariot-riders of their chariots and wounded ,many of them. The poet Shyam says that in this way Balram exhibited his bravery to the warriours.1835.

gurmukhi: kRoD BrXo rn mO Aiq kR√çr su pwn ky bIc kiRpwn lIey ]AiBmwn so folq hY rn BIqr Awn ko Awnq hY n hIey ]
transliteration: Krodh Bdaryo Ran Mau At(i) Kroor Su Paan Ke Beech Kridaan Leee Abhimaan So Dolat Hai Ran Bheetar Aan Ko Aanat Kridaan Heee||
translation: Balram is proudly moving in the war-arena, filled with me and taking his sword in his hand; he is not caring for anyone else;

gurmukhi: Aiq hI rs rudR ky bIc CikE kib sXwm khY md pwn pIey ]blBdR sMGwrq S`qR iPrY jm ko su BXwnk rUp kIey ]1836]
transliteration: At(i) Hiras Rudra Ke Beech Chhakio Kabi Syaam Kahai Mad Paan Peee|| Balbhadra Sanhaarat Shattra Phirai Jam Ko Su Bhayaanak Roop Keee||1836||
translation: He looks like the one intoxicated with wine and filled with ire and is killing the enemies manifesting himself like the dreadful Yama.1836.

gurmukhi: sIs ktY Air bIrn ky Aiq hI mn BIqr kop Bry hY ]kyqn ky pd pwn kty Air kyqn ky qn Gwie kry hY ]
transliteration: Sees Katai Ar(i) Bderan Ke At(i) Himan Bheetar Kop Bhare Hai|| Ketan Ke Pad Paan Kate Ar(i) Ketan Ke Tan Ghaae Dare Hai||
translation: In great fury, the heads of the enemies were cut down; the hands and feet of many have been cut and there are wounds on other parts of the body of many warriors;

gurmukhi: jy blbMf khwvq hY inj Taur ko Cwif kY daur pry hY ]qIr srIrn bIc lgy Bt mwnhu syh srUp Dry hY ]1837]
transliteration: Je Balband Kahaavat Hai Nij Thaur Ko Chhaad(i) Kai Daur Dare Hai|| Teer Darderan Beech Lage Bhat Maanoh She Saroop Ddare Hai||1837||
translation: Those who called themselves as powerful ones have left their places and fled and the warriors inflicted with arrows look like porcupine.1837.

gurmukhi: ieq AYsy hlwXuD ju`Du kIXo auiq sRI biRj BUKn kopu bFwXo ]jo Bt swmuih Awie gXo soaU eyk hI bwn so mwr igrwXo ]
transliteration: It Aise Halaayudh Juddh(u) Keeyo Out(i) Sribrij Bhookhan Kop(u) Badhyo|| Jo Bhat Saamuh(i) Aae Gado Sooo Ek Hibaan So Maar Giraayo||
translation: On this side Balram waged war like this and on that side Krishna, getting enraged, knocked down anyone with a single arrow, whoever confronted him;

gurmukhi: Aaur ijqo niRpsYn huqo su inmyK ibKY jm Dwm pTwXo ]kwhU n DIr DrXo icq mY BijgY jb sXwm ieqo rn pwXo ]1838]
transliteration: Aur Jito Nripsain Houto Su Nimekh Bikhai Jam Dhaam Pathaayo|| Kaahoo Na Dheer Ddaryo Chit Mai Bhaj(i)gad Jab Syaam Ito Ran Paayo||1838||
translation: All the army of the king that was there, he despatched it to the abode of Yama in an instant; seeing such a fighting of Krishna, all the enemies, forsaking their endurance, ran away.1838.

gurmukhi: jy Bt lwj Bry Aiq hI pRB kwrj jwn kY kop bFwey ]SMkih qXwg ASMkq huie su bjwie inSwnin ko smuhwey ]
transliteration: Je Bhat Laaj Bhare At(i) Hiprabh Kaaraj Jaan Kai Kop Badhaae|| Shankah(i) Tyaag Ashankat Hue Su Bajaae Nishaanan(i) Ko Samuhaae||
translation: Those warriors who were feeling ashamed, they also now with the object of defeating Krishna, got infuriated and forsaking their hesitation and playing on their war-drums, came in front of him;

gurmukhi: swrMg sRI biRjnwQ lY hwQ su KYNc cFwie kY bwn clwey ]sXwm BnY blbMf bfy sr eyk hI eyk sO mwr igrwey ]1839]
transliteration: Saaran Sribrijnaath Lai Haath Su Khainch Chadhaae Kai Baan Chadhaae|| Syaam Bhanai Balbaand Bade Sar Ek Hiek Sau Maar Giraae||1839||
translation: Krishna holding his bow in his hand discharged his arrows and he knocked down a hundred enemies with single arrow.1839.

gurmukhi: jrwisMD ko dlu hir mwrXo ]BUpiq ko sB grb auqwrXo ]Aib khu kaun aupwvh kro ]rn mY Awj jUJ hI mro ]1840]
transliteration: Jaraasindh Ko Dal(u) Har(i) Mdaryo|| Bhoopat(i) Ko Sabh Gadab Outdaryo|| Ab(i) Kauh Kaoun Oupaavohdaro|| Rn Mai Aaj Joojh Hdaro||1840||
translation: The army of Jarasandh was knocked down by Krishna and in this way pulverized the pride of the king; the king thought that then what step should he taken, and how should he die in the war on that day?1840.
